content.description: Fun short route. Varied holds to an easy topout.
content.location: On the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the jugs in the back corner, make a long move with big feet to the good crimps way out left, from here enter the crux. Pick some feet and grab the good crimp in the roof, work your feet around and turn the roof on good holds to massive jugs at the top of the boulder

Sit start on two opposing sidepulls just right of The Mystic, and reach up to a very small 3 finger crimp. Traverse with sequential feet right into the start of Sunday Funday. Top out as per that problem on fun giant holds.
content.location: Right next to the mystic, left of sunday funday.Â

content.description: Start sitting as for 'Ancient Highway" but climb straight up using the arete and a good face crimp, balancing your way up to the good hold at the top.
content.location: The right most line on the Roadside Boulder

content.description: Start sitting with your left hand on a good side pull and right on a good gaston. Pull up and make crux moves across slopers with help of a few holds out to the right before topping out on jugs.
content.location: On the left side of the boulder.

content.description:
Stand start on a good side pull and a cool incut pocket right on the arete. Move up to twin crimps, then hit the jug on the lower lip, from the jug top out up and slightly left. 

  The landing is awkward do to the rounded boulder at the base of the line. However, with pads and spotters it is very safe.
content.location: The arete to the right of Sunday Funday.

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the right face of the boulder on two crimps, pull up and traverse good incut crimps left towards the roof, traverse the lip of the roof on jugs and top out as for 'Streaked Roof'. There is no defined crux on this route, just many moves.
content.location: On the right side on the 'Roadside Boulder', start on two crimps to the right of the roof and just left of a tree.

content.description: Home to some fun short routes, this boulder can been seen from the road but is about 20ft in the woods.
